laughed-within.context: Sarah laughs when she hears she will bear a child at 90
laughed-within.mood: disbelief, wonder, the absurdity of hope

god-made-me-laugh.context: Sarah names her son Isaac (meaning 'laughter') after his miraculous birth
god-made-me-laugh.hebrew: צְחֹק עָשָׂה לִי אֱלֹהִים כָּל הַשֹּׁמֵעַ יִצְחַק לִי
god-made-me-laugh.english: God has made laughter for me; everyone who hears will laugh with me

three-visitors.context: Abraham tells Sarah to prepare food for the three mysterious visitors
three-visitors.hebrew: מַהֲרִי שְׁלֹשׁ סְאִים קֶמַח סֹלֶת לוּשִׁי וַעֲשִׂי עֻגוֹת
three-visitors.english: Quick! Three measures of fine flour! Knead it and make cakes!

cast-out-slave.context: Sarah demands that Hagar and Ishmael be sent away to protect Isaac
cast-out-slave.english: Cast out this slave woman and her son
cast-out-slave.mood: fierce protection, maternal instinct, difficult decision

father-of-nations.context: God's promise that Sarah will be mother of nations
father-of-nations.hebrew: וּבֵרַכְתִּי אֹתָהּ וְגַם נָתַתִּי מִמֶּנָּה לְךָ בֵּן
father-of-nations.english: I will bless her, and she shall give rise to nations; kings of peoples shall come from her

mother-of-nations.context: God renames Sarai to Sarah, meaning 'princess'
mother-of-nations.english: Sarah shall be her name... she shall be a mother of nations

where-is-sarah.context: The visitors ask Abraham about Sarah's whereabouts
